intro: Tococa hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy tococa, is a climbing plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Tococa hirsuta is often found in humid, shaded environments within the undergrowth of tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the rainforest's biodiversity.
